Editing the List
If you would like to make suggestions to this list, please do so either by creating an issue or a pull request on the GitHub repo (prefered) or via email. Please note that this list specifically focuses on undergraduate Bayesian education. If you are making suggestions of a resource, please note how it is appropriate at the undergraduate level if it is not obvious from the title or abstract.

articles.title: Undergraduate Bayesian Education
articles.contents: This website is intended for educators who teach or are interested in teaching Bayesian Statistics at the undergraduate level. You can find resources and join the Undergraduate Bayesian Education Network.

articles.title: Undergraduate Bayesian Education Network
articles.description: A virtual place to connect with other Bayesian educators
articles.contents: Undergraduate Bayesian Network: A Slack workspace to connect undergraduate Bayesian educators. If you are teaching a Bayesian course at the undergraduate level or interested in teaching one, please email Alicia Johnson, Miles Ott, Mine Dogucu or Jingchen (Monika) Hu to join the network.

articles.contents:
Papers
Albert, J., & Hu, J. (2020). Bayesian Computing in the Statistics and Data Science Curriculum. arXiv preprint arXiv:2002.09716.
Bolstad, W. M. (2002). Teaching Bayesian statistics to undergraduates: Who, what, where, when, why, and how. In Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference on Teaching of Statistics.
Hoegh, A (2020). Why Bayesian ideas should be introduced in the Statistics curricula and how to do so. Journal of Statistics Education
Hu, J. (2019). A Bayesian Statistics Course for Undergraduates: Bayesian Thinking, Computing and Research. arXiv preprint arXiv:1910.05818.
Johnson, A., Rundel, C., Hu, J., Ross, K., & Rossman, A. (2020). Teaching an Undergraduate Course in Bayesian Statistics: A Panel Discussion. Journal of Statistics Education, 28(3), 251-261.
Page, R., & Satake, E. (2017). Beyond P Values and Hypothesis Testing: Using the Minimum Bayes Factor to Teach Statistical Inference in Undergraduate Introductory Statistics Courses. Journal of Education and Learning, 6(4), 254-266.
Sarafoglou, A., van der Heijden, A., Draws, T., Cornelisse, J., Wagenmakers, E. J., & Marsman, M. (2018). Combine Statistical Thinking With Scientific Practice: A Protocol of a Bayesian Thesis Project For Undergraduate Students. arXiv preprint arXiv:1810.07496.
Stewart, S., & Stewart, W. (2014). Teaching Bayesian statistics to undergraduate students through debates. Innovations in Education and Teaching International, 51(6), 653-663.
Stewart, W., & Stewart, S. (2014). Teaching Markov Chain Monte Carlo: Revealing the Basic Ideas Behind the Algorithm. PRIMUS, 24(1), 25-45.
van Doorn, J., Matzke, D., & Wagenmakers, E. J. (2020). An in-class demonstration of Bayesian inference. Psychology Learning & Teaching, 19(1), 36-45.
Witmer, J. (2017). Bayes and MCMC for undergraduates. The American Statistician, 71(3), 259-264.
